content: But before that day, God warns men of what is coming. He has always given men warning of coming judgments. Some believed the warning and obeyed the word of God. These escaped the judgments that fell upon the disobedient and unbelieving.

refcode_long: The Story of Jesus, p. 179.5 (Ellen Gould White)
content: Before He destroyed the world by a flood, God commanded Noah, “Come thou and all thy house into the ark; for thee have I seen righteous before Me.” Genesis 7:1. Noah obeyed and was saved. Before the destruction of Sodom, angels brought to Lot the message, “Up, get you out of this place; for the Lord will destroy this city.” Genesis 19:14. Lot heeded the warning and was saved.

refcode_long: The Story of Jesus, p. 180.1 (Ellen Gould White)
content: So now we are warned of Christ's second coming and of the destruction that is to fall upon the world, and all who heed the warning will be saved.

refcode_long: The Story of Jesus, p. 180.2 (Ellen Gould White)
content: The righteous, as they behold Christ at His coming, will exclaim, “Lo, this is our God; we have waited for Him, and He will save us.” Isaiah 25:9.

refcode_long: The Story of Jesus, p. 180.3 (Ellen Gould White)
content: Because we know not the exact time of His coming we are commanded to watch. “Blessed are those servants whom the Lord when He cometh shall find watching.” Luke 12:37.

refcode_long: The Story of Jesus, p. 180.4 (Ellen Gould White)
content: Those who watch for the Lord's coming are not to wait in idleness. The expectation of Christ's coming is to make men fear God's judgments upon transgression. It is to awaken them to repentance for their sins in breaking His commandments.

refcode_long: The Story of Jesus, p. 180.5 (Ellen Gould White)
content: While we watch for the Lord's coming, we are to be diligently working. To know that He is at the door, should lead us to work more earnestly for the salvation of our fellow men. As Noah gave the warning from God to the people before the flood, so all who understand the word of God are to give warning to the people of this time.

refcode_long: The Story of Jesus, p. 180.6 (Ellen Gould White)
content: “But as the days of Noe were, so shall also the coming of the Son of man be. For as in the days that were before the flood they were eating and drinking, marrying and giving in marriage, until the day that Noe entered into the ark, and knew not until the flood came, and took them all away; so shall also the coming of the Son of man be.” Matthew 24:37-39.

refcode_long: The Story of Jesus, p. 180.7 (Ellen Gould White)
content: The people of Noah's day abused the gifts of God. Their eating and drinking led to gluttony and drunkenness.

refcode_long: The Story of Jesus, p. 181.1 (Ellen Gould White)
content: They forgot God, and gave themselves up to every vile and abominable deed.

refcode_long: The Story of Jesus, p. 181.2 (Ellen Gould White)
content: “God saw that the wickedness of man was great in the earth, and that every imagination of the thoughts of his heart was only evil continually.” Genesis 6:5. It was because of their wickedness that the people of that time were destroyed.

refcode_long: The Story of Jesus, p. 181.3 (Ellen Gould White)
content: Men are doing the same things today. Gluttony, intemperance, untamable passions, evil practices, are filling the earth with wickedness.

refcode_long: The Story of Jesus, p. 181.4 (Ellen Gould White)
content: In Noah's day the world was destroyed by water. God's word teaches that it is now to be destroyed by fire.

refcode_long: The Story of Jesus, p. 181.5 (Ellen Gould White)
content: “By the word of God, ... the world that then was, being overflowed with water, perished: but the heavens and the earth, which are now, by the same word are kept in store, reserved unto fire against the day of judgment and perdition of ungodly men.” 2 Peter 3:5-7.

refcode_long: The Story of Jesus, p. 181.6 (Ellen Gould White)
content: The people before the flood mocked at God's warnings. They called Noah a fanatic and alarmist. Great and learned men declared that such a flood of waters as he foretold had never been known, and that it would never come.

refcode_long: The Story of Jesus, p. 181.7 (Ellen Gould White)
content: Today God's word is little heeded. Men laugh at its warnings. Multitudes are saying, “All things continue as they were from the beginning of the world. There is nothing to fear.”

refcode_long: The Story of Jesus, p. 181.8 (Ellen Gould White)
content: At this very time, destruction is coming. While men ask in scorn, “Where is the promise of His coming?” the signs are fulfilling.

refcode_long: The Story of Jesus, p. 181.9 (Ellen Gould White)
content: “When they shall say, Peace and safety; then sudden destruction cometh upon them; ... and they shall not escape.” 1 Thessalonians 5:3.

refcode_long: The Story of Jesus, p. 182.1 (Ellen Gould White)
content: Christ declares: “If therefore thou shalt not watch, I will come on thee as a thief, and thou shalt not know what hour I will come upon thee.” Revelation 3:3.

refcode_long: The Story of Jesus, p. 182.2 (Ellen Gould White)
content: Today men are still taken up with eating and drinking, planting and building, marrying and giving in marriage. Merchants are still buying and selling. Men are contending for the highest place. Pleasure lovers are crowding to theaters, horse races, gambling hells. Everywhere excitement prevails; yet the day of probation is fast closing, and the door of mercy is soon to be forever shut.

refcode_long: The Story of Jesus, p. 182.3 (Ellen Gould White)
content: For us were spoken the Saviour's words of warning:

refcode_long: The Story of Jesus, p. 182.4 (Ellen Gould White)
content: “Take heed to yourselves, lest at any time your hearts be overcharged with surfeiting, and drunkenness, and cares of this life, and so that day come upon you unawares.” Luke 21:34.

refcode_long: The Story of Jesus, p. 182.5 (Ellen Gould White)
content: “Watch ye therefore, and pray always, that ye may be accounted worthy to escape all these things that shall come to pass, and to stand before the Son of man.” Luke 21:36.

refcode_long: The Story of Jesus, p. 183 (Ellen Gould White)
content: Chapter 32—The Home of the Saved

refcode_long: The Story of Jesus, p. 183.1 (Ellen Gould White)
content: The Day of Christ's coming is a day of destruction only to evil. It is a day of redemption, not only for God's people, but for the earth.

refcode_long: The Story of Jesus, p. 183.2 (Ellen Gould White)
content: God created the earth to be man's home. Here Adam dwelt in that garden of delight which the Creator Himself had beautified. Though sin has marred God's work, yet the human race has not been abandoned by its Creator; nor His purpose for the earth set aside.

refcode_long: The Story of Jesus, p. 183.3 (Ellen Gould White)
content: To this earth angels have come, with the message of redemption, and its hills and valleys have echoed their songs of rejoicing. Its soil has been trodden by the feet of the Son of God. And for more than six thousand years, in its forms of beauty and gifts for sustenance, the earth has borne witness of the Creator's love.

refcode_long: The Story of Jesus, p. 183.4 (Ellen Gould White)
content: This same earth, freed from the curse of sin, is to be man's eternal home. Of the earth the Scripture says, that God “created it not in vain, He formed it to be inhabited.” Isaiah 45:18. And “whatsoever God doeth, it shall be for ever.” Ecclesiastes 3:14.

refcode_long: The Story of Jesus, p. 184.1 (Ellen Gould White)
content: So in the Sermon on the Mount the Saviour declared, “Blessed are the meek: for they shall inherit the earth.” Matthew 5:5.

refcode_long: The Story of Jesus, p. 184.2 (Ellen Gould White)
content: So the psalmist long before had written, “The meek shall inherit the earth; and shall delight themselves in the abundance of peace.” Psalm 37:11.

refcode_long: The Story of Jesus, p. 184.3 (Ellen Gould White)
content: With this agree the words of the Scripture, “The righteous shall be recompensed in the earth.” They “shall inherit the land, and dwell therein for ever.” Proverbs 11:31; Psalm 37:29.

refcode_long: The Story of Jesus, p. 184.4 (Ellen Gould White)
content: The fires of the last day are to destroy “the heavens and the earth, which are now;” but there shall come forth “new heavens and a new earth.” 2 Peter 3:7, 13. The heavens and the earth will be made new.

refcode_long: The Story of Jesus, p. 184.5 (Ellen Gould White)
content: “Eye hath not seen, nor ear heard, neither have entered into the heart of man, the things which God hath prepared for them that love Him.” 1 Corinthians 2:9.

refcode_long: The Story of Jesus, p. 184.6 (Ellen Gould White)
content: No human language can fully describe the reward of the righteous. It will be known only to those who behold it. We can not comprehend the glory of the Paradise of God.

refcode_long: The Story of Jesus, p. 184.7 (Ellen Gould White)
content: Yet we have glimpses of that land even now; for “God hath revealed them unto us by His Spirit.” 1 Corinthians 2:10. Precious to our hearts are the pictures of that country which the Bible gives.

refcode_long: The Story of Jesus, p. 184.8 (Ellen Gould White)
content: There the heavenly Shepherd leads His flock to fountains of living waters. The tree of life yields its fruit every month, and the leaves of the tree are for the service of the nations.

refcode_long: The Story of Jesus, p. 184.9 (Ellen Gould White)
content: There are ever-flowing streams, clear as crystal, and beside them waving trees cast their shadows upon the paths prepared for the ransomed of the Lord. There the wide-spreading plains swell into hills of beauty, and the mountains of God rear their lofty summits. On those peaceful plains, beside those living streams, God's people, so long pilgrims and wanderers, shall find a home.

refcode_long: The Story of Jesus, p. 185.1 (Ellen Gould White)
content: “My people shall dwell in a peaceable habitation, and in sure dwellings, and in quiet resting places.” “Violence shall no more be heard in thy land, wasting nor destruction within thy borders; but thou shalt call thy walls Salvation, and thy gates Praise.” Isaiah 32:18; 60:18.

refcode_long: The Story of Jesus, p. 185.2 (Ellen Gould White)
content: “They shall build houses, and inhabit them; and they shall plant vineyards, and eat the fruit of them. They shall not build, and another inhabit; they shall not plant, and another eat: ... mine elect shall long enjoy the work of their hands.” Isaiah 65:21, 22.

refcode_long: The Story of Jesus, p. 185.3 (Ellen Gould White)
content: There, “the wilderness and the solitary place shall be glad for them; and the desert shall rejoice, and blossom as the rose.” “Instead of the thorn shall come up the fir tree, and instead of the briar shall come up the myrtle tree.” Isaiah 35:1; 55:13.

refcode_long: The Story of Jesus, p. 185.4 (Ellen Gould White)
content: “The wolf also shall dwell with the lamb, and the leopard shall lie down with the kid; ... and a little child shall lead them.” “They shall not hurt nor destroy in all my holy mountain,” saith the Lord. Isaiah 11:6, 9.

refcode_long: The Story of Jesus, p. 185.5 (Ellen Gould White)
content: There will be no more tears, no funeral trains, no badges of mourning. “There shall be no more death, neither sorrow, nor crying, ... for the former things are passed away.” “The inhabitant shall not say, I am sick: the people that dwell therein shall be forgiven their iniquity.” Revelation 21:4; Isaiah 33:24.

refcode_long: The Story of Jesus, p. 185.6 (Ellen Gould White)
content: There is the New Jerusalem, the capital of the glorified new earth, “a crown of glory in the hand of the Lord, and a royal diadem in the hand of thy God.” Her light is “like unto a stone most precious, even like a jasper stone, clear as crystal.” “The nations of them which are saved shall walk in the light of it: and the kings of the earth do bring their glory and honor into it.” Isaiah 62:3; 21:11, 24.

refcode_long: The Story of Jesus, p. 186.1 (Ellen Gould White)
content: The Lord says, “I will rejoice in Jerusalem, and joy in My people.” “The tabernacle of God is with men, and He will dwell with them, and they shall be His people, and God Himself shall be with them, and be their God.” Isaiah 65:19; Revelation 21:3.

refcode_long: The Story of Jesus, p. 186.2 (Ellen Gould White)
content: In the earth made new, only righteousness shall dwell. “There shall in no wise enter into it any thing that defileth, neither whatsoever worketh abomination, or maketh a lie.” Revelation 21:27.

refcode_long: The Story of Jesus, p. 186.3 (Ellen Gould White)
content: God's holy law will be honored by all beneath the sun. Those who have proved themselves true to God by keeping His commandments, shall dwell with Him.
